title: How to Buy an Arcade in Grand Theft Auto V Online: Unlock Casino Heists

steps.title: Wait until you get a text from Lester Crest.
steps.content: Wait until you get a text from Lester Crest. Lester's text will read "This is Lester Crest. Meet me at Mirror Park. We have something to discuss."

steps.title: Go to Mirror Park and talk to Lester Crest.
steps.content: Go to Mirror Park and talk to Lester Crest. After you do so, you'll be able to purchase an arcade property from Maze Bank Foreclosures. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Purchase an arcade and head over to set it up.
steps.content: Purchase an arcade and head over to set it up. You can technically buy any arcade, but Videogeddon is the best choice as it's the cheapest one in Los Santos proper. The only renovations that matter are in Extras and a Garage: Living Quarters in Extras allows you to spawn at your Arcade High Score Screens in Extras will encourage rage quits and addictions in players Garage will allow you to store vehicles at the Arcade

steps.title: Register as CEO and interact with the laptop in the arcade.
steps.content: Register as CEO and interact with the laptop in the arcade. You'll have to be a CEO before you can continue with setting up your arcade. The only mission you can start at this point is the Setup Mission for the arcade.

steps.title: Complete the Setup Mission.
steps.content: Complete the Setup Mission. Follow the in-game instructions, as this is a straightforward mission—simply go to the location noted in game, track down a stolen truck and steal it back, then drive it back to the arcade. After doing this mission, Lester will introduce you to the Diamond Casino heist, and your arcade will be fully operational.

steps.title: There are six arcades to pick from.
steps.content: There are six arcades to pick from. Each one is in a different location and is worth a different amount of money. The arcades you can choose from in GTA V Online are: Pixel Pete’s in Paleto Bay for $1,235,000 Wonderama in Grapeseed for $1,565,000 Videogeddon in La Mesa for $1,875,000 Insert Coin in Rockford Hills for $2,345,000 Warehouse in Davis for $2,135,000 Eight-Bit in Vinewood for $2,530,000

steps.title: Videogeddon is the best arcade location choice.
steps.content: Videogeddon is the best arcade location choice. There are a handful of reasons that Videogeddon is the best choice: It's closest to the Diamond Casino, where most of the heist missions will take place. It's close to a nightclub and a warehouse, so you can travel between businesses quickly. While it's not the cheapest arcade, it's far from being the most expensive.
